001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.utilities.config.ConfigSource;
004import io.cyborgcode.utilities.config.PropertyConfig;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.log.LogQuest;
006import io.cyborgcode.utilities.reflections.ReflectionUtil;
007import io.qameta.allure.Allure;
008import java.io.BufferedReader;
009import java.io.File;
010import java.io.FileInputStream;
011import java.io.FileOutputStream;
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.io.InputStreamReader;
014import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
015import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
016import java.io.Writer;
017import java.lang.reflect.Method;
018import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
019import java.nio.file.Files;
020import java.nio.file.Path;
021import java.util.AbstractMap;
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.Arrays;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.Objects;
027import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean;
028import java.util.stream.Collectors;
029import org.aeonbits.owner.Config;
030import org.aeonbits.owner.ConfigCache;
031import org.apache.logging.log4j.ThreadContext;
032import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtensionContext;
033
034import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.config.FrameworkConfigHolder.getFrameworkConfig;
035import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.storage.StoreKeys.HTML;
036import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.storage.StoreKeys.START_TIME;
037import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ObjectFormatter.escapeHtml;
038import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ObjectFormatter.formatAnnotationsToNewRows;
039import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ObjectFormatter.formatLongText;
040import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ObjectFormatter.getClassAnnotations;
041import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ObjectFormatter.getMethodAnnotations;
042import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ObjectFormatter.getTestArguments;
043import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ResourceLoader.loadResourceFile;
044
045/**
046 * Utility class for managing test metadata and attaching logs to Allure reports.
047 *
048 * <p>This class provides helper methods to:
049 * <ul>
050 *     <li>Set HTML descriptions in Allure reports.</li>
051 *     <li>Attach filtered logs based on test execution.</li>
052 *     <li>Log test outcomes with structured messages.</li>
053 *     <li>Generate and inject metadata into test reports.</li>
054 *     <li>Initialize the test environment by writing configuration properties and categories.</li>
055 *     <li>Set up the test context with start time and a unique test identifier.</li>
056 * </ul>
057 *
058 * <p>The class leverages Allure for report attachments, the OWNER library for configuration management,
059 * and reflection for dynamic retrieval of configuration properties.
060 *
061 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
062 */
063public class AllureStepHelper {
064
065   public static final String CONTENT_TYPE = "text/plain";
066
067   private AllureStepHelper() {
068   }
069
070   private static final String ALLURE_RESULTS_DIR = "target/allure-results";
071   private static final String ENVIRONMENT_PROPERTIES_FILE = "environment.properties";
072   private static final String CATEGORIES_JSON_PATH = "allure/json/categories.json";
073   private static final String FRAMEWORK_PACKAGE = "io.cyborgcode.roa";
074   private static final String CATEGORIES_JSON = "categories.json";
075   private static final AtomicBoolean ENV_INITIALIZED = new AtomicBoolean(false);
076
077   /**
078    * Sets an HTML description for the test execution in Allure reports.
079    *
080    * <p>This method retrieves HTML content stored under the {@code HTML} key in the global store of the
081    * provided {@link ExtensionContext}, filters for valid table-based content, and appends it as a formatted
082    * HTML description in Allure.
083    *
084    * @param context The test execution context.
085    */
086   public static void setDescription(ExtensionContext context) {
087      List<String> htmlContent = (List<String>) context.getStore(ExtensionContext.Namespace.GLOBAL).get(HTML);
088
089      String combinedHtml = htmlContent.stream()
090            .filter(Objects::nonNull)
091            .filter(table -> table.contains("<td>"))
092            .collect(Collectors.joining("", "<div style='margin: 20px;'>", "</div>"));
093
094      Allure.descriptionHtml(combinedHtml);
095   }
096
097   /**
098    * Attaches filtered logs to Allure based on the test name.
099    *
100    * <p>This method reads a system log file and filters for entries containing a test scenario identifier.
101    * If the test name is unavailable or if no matching log entries are found, a fallback message is attached.
102    *
103    * @param testName The name of the test scenario to filter logs for.
104    */
105   public static void attachFilteredLogsToAllure(String testName) {
106      if (testName == null || testName.isEmpty()) {
107         Allure.addAttachment("Filtered Logs", CONTENT_TYPE, "Test name is not available.", ".log");
108         return;
109      }
110
111      String logFilePath = System.getProperty("logFileName", "logs/cyborgLog.log");
112      String testIdentifier = "[scenario=" + testName + "]";
113
114      try (BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(new FileInputStream(logFilePath),
115            StandardCharsets.UTF_8))) {
116         String filteredLogs = reader.lines()
117               .filter(line -> line.contains(testIdentifier))
118               .collect(Collectors.joining(System.lineSeparator()));
119
120         String attachmentContent = filteredLogs.isEmpty()
121               ? "No logs found for test: " + testName
122               : filteredLogs;
123
124         Allure.addAttachment("Filtered Logs for Test: " + testName, CONTENT_TYPE, attachmentContent, ".log");
125      } catch (IOException e) {
126         Allure.addAttachment("Filtered Logs for Test: " + testName, CONTENT_TYPE,
127               "Failed to read logs. Error: " + e.getMessage(), ".log");
128      }
129   }
130
131   /**
132    * Logs the test outcome after execution.
133    *
134    * <p>This method logs whether the test concluded successfully or failed, along with the duration
135    * of execution. If the test failed, additional debugging details are logged.
136    *
137    * @param testName          The name of the test that was executed.
138    * @param status            The test execution status (e.g., "SUCCESS" or "FAILED").
139    * @param durationInSeconds The duration of the test execution in seconds.
140    * @param throwable         The exception thrown during execution (if any).
141    */
142   public static void logTestOutcome(String testName, String status, long durationInSeconds, Throwable throwable) {
143      String logMessage = "The quest of '{}' has "
144            + (throwable == null ? "concluded with glory" : "ended in defeat")
145            + ". Status: {}. Duration: {} seconds.";
146
147      LogQuest.info(logMessage, testName, status, durationInSeconds);
148      if (throwable != null) {
149         LogQuest.debug("Failure reason:", throwable);
150      }
151   }
152
153   /**
154    * Sets up and formats test metadata for Allure reports.
155    *
156    * <p>This method loads a predefined HTML template and dynamically populates it with:
157    * <ul>
158    *     <li>Test name and class details.</li>
159    *     <li>Annotations applied at the class and method levels.</li>
160    *     <li>Test argument values.</li>
161    * </ul>
162    * The formatted HTML is then stored under the {@code HTML} key in the global store of the
163    * provided {@link ExtensionContext} for later attachment to the Allure report.
164    *
165    * @param context The test execution context.
166    */
167   public static void setUpTestMetadata(ExtensionContext context) {
168      String htmlTemplate = ResourceLoader.loadResourceFile("allure/html/test-details.html");
169
170      Map<String, String> placeholders = Map.of(
171            "{{testName}}", escapeHtml(context.getRequiredTestMethod().getName()),
172            "{{className}}", escapeHtml(context.getRequiredTestClass().getSimpleName()),
173            "{{classAnnotations}}", formatAnnotationsToNewRows(escapeHtml(getClassAnnotations(context))),
174            "{{methodAnnotations}}", formatAnnotationsToNewRows(escapeHtml(getMethodAnnotations(context))),
175            "{{testArguments}}", formatLongText(escapeHtml(getTestArguments(context)))
176      );
177
178      String formattedHtml = placeholders.entrySet().stream()
179            .reduce(htmlTemplate, (html, entry) -> html.replace(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()), (a, b) -> a);
180      List<String> htmlList = context.getStore(ExtensionContext.Namespace.GLOBAL).get(HTML, List.class);
181      if (htmlList == null) {
182         htmlList = new ArrayList<>();
183      }
184      htmlList.add(formattedHtml);
185      context.getStore(ExtensionContext.Namespace.GLOBAL).put(HTML, htmlList);
186   }
187
188   /**
189    * Initializes the test environment by collecting configuration properties and writing them to files.
190    *
191    * <p>This method performs the following actions:
192    * <ul>
193    *     <li>Collects configuration properties from all implementations of {@link PropertyConfig}.</li>
194    *     <li>Writes the collected properties to an environment properties file.</li>
195    *     <li>Writes a JSON file containing category definitions for Allure reports.</li>
196    * </ul>
197    */
198   public static void initializeTestEnvironment() {
199      if (!ENV_INITIALIZED.compareAndSet(false, true)) {
200         return;
201      }
202      Map<String, List<String>> propertiesMap = collectConfigurationProperties();
203      writeEnvironmentProperties(propertiesMap);
204      writeCategoriesJson();
205   }
206
207   /**
208    * Collects configuration properties from all implementations of {@link PropertyConfig}.
209    *
210    * <p>This method uses reflection to find all classes implementing {@link PropertyConfig} in both the
211    * framework package and the project package. It then retrieves configuration key-value pairs from each
212    * implementation and returns them as a map.
213    *
214    * @return A map containing configuration keys and their corresponding values, annotated with their source.
215    */
216   private static Map<String, List<String>> collectConfigurationProperties() {
217      List<Class<? extends PropertyConfig>> allConfig = findAllPropertyConfigImplementations();
218
219      return allConfig.stream()
220            .flatMap(configClass -> {
221               ConfigSource configSource = configClass.getAnnotation(ConfigSource.class);
222               String configSourceValue = (configSource != null) ? configSource.value() : "unknown";
223
224               PropertyConfig propertyConfig = ConfigCache.getOrCreate(configClass);
225               return Arrays.stream(propertyConfig.getClass().getInterfaces())
226                     .filter(PropertyConfig.class::isAssignableFrom)
227                     .flatMap(intf -> Arrays.stream(intf.getDeclaredMethods()))
228                     .filter(method -> method.getAnnotation(Config.Key.class) != null)
229                     .map(method -> {
230                        try {
231                           Config.Key annotation = method.getAnnotation(Config.Key.class);
232                           String key = annotation.value();
233                           Object value = method.invoke(propertyConfig);
234
235                           if (value == null || value.toString().trim().isEmpty()) {
236                              LogQuest.debug("Skipping key '" + key + "' because value is empty or null.");
237                              return null;
238                           }
239
240                           return new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<>(
241                                 key,
242                                 value + " (Source: " + configSourceValue + ")"
243                           );
244                        } catch (Exception e) {
245                           LogQuest.error("Error processing " + method.getName(), e);
246                           return null;
247                        }
248                     })
249                     .filter(Objects::nonNull);
250            })
251            .collect(Collectors.groupingBy(
252                  Map.Entry::getKey,
253                  Collectors.mapping(Map.Entry::getValue, Collectors.toList())
254            ));
255   }
256
257   /**
258    * Finds all implementations of the {@link PropertyConfig} interface within the framework and project packages.
259    *
260    * <p>This method leverages the {@link ReflectionUtil} to search for classes that implement {@link PropertyConfig}
261    * in both the framework's base package and the project-specific package defined in the framework configuration.
262    *
263    * @return A list of classes implementing {@link PropertyConfig}.
264    */
265   private static List<Class<? extends PropertyConfig>> findAllPropertyConfigImplementations() {
266      List<Class<? extends PropertyConfig>> implementationsOfInterfaceInFramework =
267            ReflectionUtil.findImplementationsOfInterface(PropertyConfig.class, FRAMEWORK_PACKAGE);
268      List<Class<? extends PropertyConfig>> implementationsOfInterfaceInProject =
269            ReflectionUtil.findImplementationsOfInterface(PropertyConfig.class, getFrameworkConfig().projectPackages());
270
271      List<Class<? extends PropertyConfig>> allConfig = new ArrayList<>();
272      allConfig.addAll(implementationsOfInterfaceInFramework);
273      allConfig.addAll(implementationsOfInterfaceInProject);
274      return allConfig;
275   }
276
277   /**
278    * Writes the collected configuration properties to the environment properties file.
279    *
280    * <p>The file is written to the {@code allure-results} directory. If the directory does not exist,
281    * it is created.
282    *
283    * @param propertiesMap A map containing configuration keys and values.
284    * @throws RuntimeException if writing to the file fails.
285    */
286   private static void writeEnvironmentProperties(Map<String, List<String>> propertiesMap) {
287      Path resultsDir = allureResultsPath();
288
289      try {
290         Files.createDirectories(resultsDir);
291         Path environmentFile = resultsDir.resolve(ENVIRONMENT_PROPERTIES_FILE);
292
293         try (Writer writer = Files.newBufferedWriter(environmentFile, StandardCharsets.UTF_8)) {
294            for (Map.Entry<String, List<String>> entry : propertiesMap.entrySet()) {
295               writer.write(entry.getKey() + "=" + String.join(", ", entry.getValue()));
296               writer.write(System.lineSeparator());
297            }
298         }
299      } catch (IOException e) {
300         throw new UncheckedIOException("Failed to write environment.properties in: " + resultsDir.toAbsolutePath(), e);
301      }
302   }
303
304   /**
305    * Resolves the Allure results directory path.
306    *
307    * <p>This method respects the {@code allure.results.directory} system property when present,
308    * and falls back to {@code target/allure-results} when it is not set.
309    *
310    * @return The resolved path to the Allure results directory.
311    */
312   private static Path allureResultsPath() {
313      String dir = System.getProperty("allure.results.directory", ALLURE_RESULTS_DIR);
314      return Path.of(dir);
315   }
316
317   /**
318    * Writes the categories JSON file for Allure reports.
319    *
320    * <p>This method loads the JSON content from a resource file and writes it to a file named
321    * {@code categories.json} in the {@code allure-results} directory.
322    *
323    * @throws RuntimeException if writing to the file fails.
324    */
325   private static void writeCategoriesJson() {
326      String categoriesJson = loadResourceFile(CATEGORIES_JSON_PATH);
327      File allureResultsDir = new File(ALLURE_RESULTS_DIR);
328
329      if (!allureResultsDir.exists() && !allureResultsDir.mkdirs()) {
330         throw new UncheckedIOException(new IOException("Failed to create allure results directory: "
331               + allureResultsDir.getAbsolutePath()));
332      }
333
334      File categoriesFile = new File(allureResultsDir, CATEGORIES_JSON);
335      try (Writer writer = new OutputStreamWriter(new FileOutputStream(categoriesFile), StandardCharsets.UTF_8)) {
336         writer.write(categoriesJson);
337      } catch (IOException e) {
338         throw new UncheckedIOException("Failed to write categories.json file", e);
339      }
340   }
341
342   /**
343    * Sets up the test context by storing the test name and start time.
344    *
345    * <p>This method extracts the simple names of the test class and method from the provided
346    * {@link ExtensionContext} and stores them in the {@link ThreadContext} under the key "testName".
347    * Additionally, it stores the current system time in milliseconds as the test start time in the global store.
348    *
349    * @param context The test execution context.
350    */
351   public static void setupTestContext(ExtensionContext context) {
352      String className = context.getTestClass()
353            .map(Class::getSimpleName)
354            .orElse("UnknownClass");
355      String methodName = context.getTestMethod()
356            .map(Method::getName)
357            .orElse("UnknownMethod");
358
359      ThreadContext.put("testName", className + "." + methodName);
360      context.getStore(ExtensionContext.Namespace.GLOBAL).put(START_TIME, System.currentTimeMillis());
361   }
362
363}
